metadata.name: TMCF | MetaScholars NFT 01
metadata.description:
Established in 1987, Thurgood Marshall College Fund (TMCF) is the nationâ€™s largest organization exclusively representing the Black College Community.  TMCF carries forward the legacy of Justice Thurgood Marshall by championing the ambitions of HBCU students through scholarships, up-skilling and equity programs, and career opportunities with top-tier organizations.  

The Division of  Innovation & Entrepreneurship (I&E) at TMCF created MetaScholars as a robust program designed to equip future tech leaders with the tools, resources, and skills they need to compete in the rapidly emerging "meta-future." As the first-ever MetaScholars, they step into the world to proactively reduce the #metadivide in the wake of one of the biggest technological shifts in over two decades. 

This boutique collection of 12 NFTs represents the dedication of the first cohort, and is a reminder of the three core tenets of the MetaScholars Program: connection, innovation, and discovery (depicted from left to right in the art work).
